intro: Pithecellobium turneri, commonly known as the white-flowered acacia, is a small evergreen shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant features bipinnate leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its fruit is a legume that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in ecological systems. Pithecellobium turneri is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive foliage and flowering habit.
